FuncDef:
The ip path detection packet-format icmp command enables the connectivity detection function and sets the packet type for connectivity detection to ICMPv4 Echo Request message.
The undo ip path detection packet-format icmp command restores the default settings. The ip path detection packet-format icmp command enables the connectivity detection function and sets the packet type for connectivity detection to ICMPv4 Echo Request message. The undo ip path detection packet-format icmp command restores the default settings. By default, the connectivity detection function is disabled. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: ip path detection packet-format icmp src-ip <srcip> dst-ip <dstip>
undo ip path detection packet-format icmp src-ip <srcip> dst-ip <dstip>

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the destination IPv4 address as the detection flag.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Sets the source IPv4 address as the detection flag.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Examples: [~HUAWEI] ip path detection packet-format icmp src-ip 10.1.1.1 dst-ip 10.2.2.2
